00021 /*
00022  * This file contains an example implementation of the Scale effect
00023  * applyed to a generic bitmap.
00024  *
00025  * You can find an high level description of the effect at :
00026  *
00027  * http://scale2x.sourceforge.net/
00028  *
00029  * Alternatively at the previous license terms, you are allowed to use this
00030  * code in your program with these conditions:
00031  * - the program is not used in commercial activities.
00032  * - the whole source code of the program is released with the binary.
00033  * - derivative works of the program are allowed.
00034  */
00035 
00036 #if HAVE_CONFIG_H
00037 #include <config.h>
00038 #endif
00039 
00040 #include "scale2x.h"
00041 #include "scale3x.h"
00042 
00043 #if HAVE_ALLOCA_H
00044 #include <alloca.h>
00045 #endif
00046 
00047 #include <assert.h>
00048 #include <stdlib.h>
00049 
00050 #define SSDST(bits, num) (scale2x_uint##bits *)dst##num
00051 #define SSSRC(bits, num) (const scale2x_uint##bits *)src##num
00052 
00053 /**
00054  * Apply the Scale2x effect on a group of rows. Used internally.
00055  */
00056 static inline void stage_scale2x(void* dst0, void* dst1, const void* src0, const void* src1, const void* src2, unsigned pixel, unsigned pixel_per_row)
00057 {
00058  switch (pixel) {
00059 #if defined(__GNUC__) && defined(__i386__)
00060   case 1 : scale2x_8_mmx(SSDST(8,0), SSDST(8,1), SSSRC(8,0), SSSRC(8,1), SSSRC(8,2), pixel_per_row); break;
00061   case 2 : scale2x_16_mmx(SSDST(16,0), SSDST(16,1), SSSRC(16,0), SSSRC(16,1), SSSRC(16,2), pixel_per_row); break;
00062   case 4 : scale2x_32_mmx(SSDST(32,0), SSDST(32,1), SSSRC(32,0), SSSRC(32,1), SSSRC(32,2), pixel_per_row); break;
00063 #else
00064   case 1 : scale2x_8_def(SSDST(8,0), SSDST(8,1), SSSRC(8,0), SSSRC(8,1), SSSRC(8,2), pixel_per_row); break;
00065   case 2 : scale2x_16_def(SSDST(16,0), SSDST(16,1), SSSRC(16,0), SSSRC(16,1), SSSRC(16,2), pixel_per_row); break;
00066   case 4 : scale2x_32_def(SSDST(32,0), SSDST(32,1), SSSRC(32,0), SSSRC(32,1), SSSRC(32,2), pixel_per_row); break;
00067 #endif
00068  }
00069 }
00070 
00071 /**
00072  * Apply the Scale2x3 effect on a group of rows. Used internally.
00073  */
00074 static inline void stage_scale2x3(void* dst0, void* dst1, void* dst2, const void* src0, const void* src1, const void* src2, unsigned pixel, unsigned pixel_per_row)
00075 {
00076  switch (pixel) {
00077 #if defined(__GNUC__) && defined(__i386__)
00078   case 1 : scale2x3_8_mmx(SSDST(8,0), SSDST(8,1), SSDST(8,2), SSSRC(8,0), SSSRC(8,1), SSSRC(8,2), pixel_per_row); break;
00079   case 2 : scale2x3_16_mmx(SSDST(16,0), SSDST(16,1), SSDST(16,2), SSSRC(16,0), SSSRC(16,1), SSSRC(16,2), pixel_per_row); break;
00080   case 4 : scale2x3_32_mmx(SSDST(32,0), SSDST(32,1), SSDST(32,2), SSSRC(32,0), SSSRC(32,1), SSSRC(32,2), pixel_per_row); break;
00081 #else
00082   case 1 : scale2x3_8_def(SSDST(8,0), SSDST(8,1), SSDST(8,2), SSSRC(8,0), SSSRC(8,1), SSSRC(8,2), pixel_per_row); break;
00083   case 2 : scale2x3_16_def(SSDST(16,0), SSDST(16,1), SSDST(16,2), SSSRC(16,0), SSSRC(16,1), SSSRC(16,2), pixel_per_row); break;
00084   case 4 : scale2x3_32_def(SSDST(32,0), SSDST(32,1), SSDST(32,2), SSSRC(32,0), SSSRC(32,1), SSSRC(32,2), pixel_per_row); break;
00085 #endif
00086  }
00087 }
00088 
00089 /**
00090  * Apply the Scale2x4 effect on a group of rows. Used internally.
00091  */
00092 static inline void stage_scale2x4(void* dst0, void* dst1, void* dst2, void* dst3, const void* src0, const void* src1, const void* src2, unsigned pixel, unsigned pixel_per_row)
00093 {
00094  switch (pixel) {
00095 #if defined(__GNUC__) && defined(__i386__)
00096   case 1 : scale2x4_8_mmx(SSDST(8,0), SSDST(8,1), SSDST(8,2), SSDST(8,3), SSSRC(8,0), SSSRC(8,1), SSSRC(8,2), pixel_per_row); break;
00097   case 2 : scale2x4_16_mmx(SSDST(16,0), SSDST(16,1), SSDST(16,2), SSDST(16,3), SSSRC(16,0), SSSRC(16,1), SSSRC(16,2), pixel_per_row); break;
00098   case 4 : scale2x4_32_mmx(SSDST(32,0), SSDST(32,1), SSDST(32,2), SSDST(32,3), SSSRC(32,0), SSSRC(32,1), SSSRC(32,2), pixel_per_row); break;
00099 #else
00100   case 1 : scale2x4_8_def(SSDST(8,0), SSDST(8,1), SSDST(8,2), SSDST(8,3), SSSRC(8,0), SSSRC(8,1), SSSRC(8,2), pixel_per_row); break;
00101   case 2 : scale2x4_16_def(SSDST(16,0), SSDST(16,1), SSDST(16,2), SSDST(16,3), SSSRC(16,0), SSSRC(16,1), SSSRC(16,2), pixel_per_row); break;
00102   case 4 : scale2x4_32_def(SSDST(32,0), SSDST(32,1), SSDST(32,2), SSDST(32,3), SSSRC(32,0), SSSRC(32,1), SSSRC(32,2), pixel_per_row); break;
00103 #endif
00104  }
00105 }
00106 
00107 /**
00108  * Apply the Scale3x effect on a group of rows. Used internally.
00109  */
00110 static inline void stage_scale3x(void* dst0, void* dst1, void* dst2, const void* src0, const void* src1, const void* src2, unsigned pixel, unsigned pixel_per_row)
00111 {
00112  switch (pixel) {
00113   case 1 : scale3x_8_def(SSDST(8,0), SSDST(8,1), SSDST(8,2), SSSRC(8,0), SSSRC(8,1), SSSRC(8,2), pixel_per_row); break;
00114   case 2 : scale3x_16_def(SSDST(16,0), SSDST(16,1), SSDST(16,2), SSSRC(16,0), SSSRC(16,1), SSSRC(16,2), pixel_per_row); break;
00115   case 4 : scale3x_32_def(SSDST(32,0), SSDST(32,1), SSDST(32,2), SSSRC(32,0), SSSRC(32,1), SSSRC(32,2), pixel_per_row); break;
00116  }
00117 }
00118 
00119 /**
00120  * Apply the Scale4x effect on a group of rows. Used internally.
00121  */
00122 static inline void stage_scale4x(void* dst0, void* dst1, void* dst2, void* dst3, const void* src0, const void* src1, const void* src2, const void* src3, unsigned pixel, unsigned pixel_per_row)
00123 {
00124  stage_scale2x(dst0, dst1, src0, src1, src2, pixel, 2 * pixel_per_row);
00125  stage_scale2x(dst2, dst3, src1, src2, src3, pixel, 2 * pixel_per_row);
00126 }
00127 
00128 #define SCDST(i) (dst+(i)*dst_slice)
00129 #define SCSRC(i) (src+(i)*src_slice)
00130 #define SCMID(i) (mid[(i)])
00131 
00132 /**
00133  * Apply the Scale2x effect on a bitmap.
00134  * The destination bitmap is filled with the scaled version of the source bitmap.
00135  * The source bitmap isn't modified.
00136  * The destination bitmap must be manually allocated before calling the function,
00137  * note that the resulting size is exactly 2x2 times the size of the source bitmap.
00138  * \param void_dst Pointer at the first pixel of the destination bitmap.
00139  * \param dst_slice Size in bytes of a destination bitmap row.
00140  * \param void_src Pointer at the first pixel of the source bitmap.
00141  * \param src_slice Size in bytes of a source bitmap row.
00142  * \param pixel Bytes per pixel of the source and destination bitmap.
00143  * \param width Horizontal size in pixels of the source bitmap.
00144  * \param height Vertical size in pixels of the source bitmap.
00145  */
00146 static void scale2x(void* void_dst, unsigned dst_slice, const void* void_src, unsigned src_slice, unsigned pixel, unsigned width, unsigned height)
00147 {
00148  unsigned char* dst = (unsigned char*)void_dst;
00149  const unsigned char* src = (const unsigned char*)void_src;
00150  unsigned count;
00151  
00152  assert(height >= 2);
00153  
00154  count = height;
00155  
00156  stage_scale2x(SCDST(0), SCDST(1), SCSRC(0), SCSRC(0), SCSRC(1), pixel, width);
00157  
00158  dst = SCDST(2);
00159  
00160  count -= 2;
00161  while (count) {
00162   stage_scale2x(SCDST(0), SCDST(1), SCSRC(0), SCSRC(1), SCSRC(2), pixel, width);
00163   
00164   dst = SCDST(2);
00165   src = SCSRC(1);
00166   
00167   --count;
00168  }
00169  
00170  stage_scale2x(SCDST(0), SCDST(1), SCSRC(0), SCSRC(1), SCSRC(1), pixel, width);
00171  
00172 #if defined(__GNUC__) && defined(__i386__)
00173  scale2x_mmx_emms();
00174 #endif
00175 }
00176 
00177 /**
00178  * Apply the Scale2x3 effect on a bitmap.
00179  * The destination bitmap is filled with the scaled version of the source bitmap.
00180  * The source bitmap isn't modified.
00181  * The destination bitmap must be manually allocated before calling the function,
00182  * note that the resulting size is exactly 2x3 times the size of the source bitmap.
00183  * \param void_dst Pointer at the first pixel of the destination bitmap.
00184  * \param dst_slice Size in bytes of a destination bitmap row.
00185  * \param void_src Pointer at the first pixel of the source bitmap.
00186  * \param src_slice Size in bytes of a source bitmap row.
00187  * \param pixel Bytes per pixel of the source and destination bitmap.
00188  * \param width Horizontal size in pixels of the source bitmap.
00189  * \param height Vertical size in pixels of the source bitmap.
00190  */
00191 static void scale2x3(void* void_dst, unsigned dst_slice, const void* void_src, unsigned src_slice, unsigned pixel, unsigned width, unsigned height)
00192 {
00193  unsigned char* dst = (unsigned char*)void_dst;
00194  const unsigned char* src = (const unsigned char*)void_src;
00195  unsigned count;
00196  
00197  assert(height >= 2);
00198  
00199  count = height;
00200  
00201  stage_scale2x3(SCDST(0), SCDST(1), SCDST(2), SCSRC(0), SCSRC(0), SCSRC(1), pixel, width);
00202  
00203  dst = SCDST(3);
00204  
00205  count -= 2;
00206  while (count) {
00207   stage_scale2x3(SCDST(0), SCDST(1), SCDST(2), SCSRC(0), SCSRC(1), SCSRC(2), pixel, width);
00208   
00209   dst = SCDST(3);
00210   src = SCSRC(1);
00211   
00212   --count;
00213  }
00214  
00215  stage_scale2x3(SCDST(0), SCDST(1), SCDST(2), SCSRC(0), SCSRC(1), SCSRC(1), pixel, width);
00216  
00217 #if defined(__GNUC__) && defined(__i386__)
00218  scale2x_mmx_emms();
00219 #endif
00220 }
00221 
00222 /**
00223  * Apply the Scale2x4 effect on a bitmap.
00224  * The destination bitmap is filled with the scaled version of the source bitmap.
00225  * The source bitmap isn't modified.
00226  * The destination bitmap must be manually allocated before calling the function,
00227  * note that the resulting size is exactly 2x4 times the size of the source bitmap.
00228  * \param void_dst Pointer at the first pixel of the destination bitmap.
00229  * \param dst_slice Size in bytes of a destination bitmap row.
00230  * \param void_src Pointer at the first pixel of the source bitmap.
00231  * \param src_slice Size in bytes of a source bitmap row.
00232  * \param pixel Bytes per pixel of the source and destination bitmap.
00233  * \param width Horizontal size in pixels of the source bitmap.
00234  * \param height Vertical size in pixels of the source bitmap.
00235  */
00236 static void scale2x4(void* void_dst, unsigned dst_slice, const void* void_src, unsigned src_slice, unsigned pixel, unsigned width, unsigned height)
00237 {
00238  unsigned char* dst = (unsigned char*)void_dst;
00239  const unsigned char* src = (const unsigned char*)void_src;
00240  unsigned count;
00241  
00242  assert(height >= 2);
00243  
00244  count = height;
00245  
00246  stage_scale2x4(SCDST(0), SCDST(1), SCDST(2), SCDST(3), SCSRC(0), SCSRC(0), SCSRC(1), pixel, width);
00247  
00248  dst = SCDST(4);
00249  
00250  count -= 2;
00251  while (count) {
00252   stage_scale2x4(SCDST(0), SCDST(1), SCDST(2), SCDST(3), SCSRC(0), SCSRC(1), SCSRC(2), pixel, width);
00253   
00254   dst = SCDST(4);
00255   src = SCSRC(1);
00256   
00257   --count;
00258  }
00259  
00260  stage_scale2x4(SCDST(0), SCDST(1), SCDST(2), SCDST(3), SCSRC(0), SCSRC(1), SCSRC(1), pixel, width);
00261  
00262 #if defined(__GNUC__) && defined(__i386__)
00263  scale2x_mmx_emms();
00264 #endif
00265 }
00266 
00267 /**
00268  * Apply the Scale3x effect on a bitmap.
00269  * The destination bitmap is filled with the scaled version of the source bitmap.
00270  * The source bitmap isn't modified.
00271  * The destination bitmap must be manually allocated before calling the function,
00272  * note that the resulting size is exactly 3x3 times the size of the source bitmap.
00273  * \param void_dst Pointer at the first pixel of the destination bitmap.
00274  * \param dst_slice Size in bytes of a destination bitmap row.
00275  * \param void_src Pointer at the first pixel of the source bitmap.
00276  * \param src_slice Size in bytes of a source bitmap row.
00277  * \param pixel Bytes per pixel of the source and destination bitmap.
00278  * \param width Horizontal size in pixels of the source bitmap.
00279  * \param height Vertical size in pixels of the source bitmap.
00280  */
00281 static void scale3x(void* void_dst, unsigned dst_slice, const void* void_src, unsigned src_slice, unsigned pixel, unsigned width, unsigned height)
00282 {
00283  unsigned char* dst = (unsigned char*)void_dst;
00284  const unsigned char* src = (const unsigned char*)void_src;
00285  unsigned count;
00286  
00287  assert(height >= 2);
00288  
00289  count = height;
00290  
00291  stage_scale3x(SCDST(0), SCDST(1), SCDST(2), SCSRC(0), SCSRC(0), SCSRC(1), pixel, width);
00292  
00293  dst = SCDST(3);
00294  
00295  count -= 2;
00296  while (count) {
00297   stage_scale3x(SCDST(0), SCDST(1), SCDST(2), SCSRC(0), SCSRC(1), SCSRC(2), pixel, width);
00298   
00299   dst = SCDST(3);
00300   src = SCSRC(1);
00301   
00302   --count;
00303  }
00304  
00305  stage_scale3x(SCDST(0), SCDST(1), SCDST(2), SCSRC(0), SCSRC(1), SCSRC(1), pixel, width);
00306 }
00307 
00308 /**
00309  * Apply the Scale4x effect on a bitmap.
00310  * The destination bitmap is filled with the scaled version of the source bitmap.
00311  * The source bitmap isn't modified.
00312  * The destination bitmap must be manually allocated before calling the function,
00313  * note that the resulting size is exactly 4x4 times the size of the source bitmap.
00314  * \note This function requires also a small buffer bitmap used internally to store
00315  * intermediate results. This bitmap must have at least an horizontal size in bytes of 2*width*pixel,
00316  * and a vertical size of 6 rows. The memory of this buffer must not be allocated
00317  * in video memory because it's also read and not only written. Generally
00318  * a heap (malloc) or a stack (alloca) buffer is the best choice.
00319  * \param void_dst Pointer at the first pixel of the destination bitmap.
00320  * \param dst_slice Size in bytes of a destination bitmap row.
00321  * \param void_mid Pointer at the first pixel of the buffer bitmap.
00322  * \param mid_slice Size in bytes of a buffer bitmap row.
00323  * \param void_src Pointer at the first pixel of the source bitmap.
00324  * \param src_slice Size in bytes of a source bitmap row.
00325  * \param pixel Bytes per pixel of the source and destination bitmap.
00326  * \param width Horizontal size in pixels of the source bitmap.
00327  * \param height Vertical size in pixels of the source bitmap.
00328  */
00329 static void scale4x_buf(void* void_dst, unsigned dst_slice, void* void_mid, unsigned mid_slice, const void* void_src, unsigned src_slice, unsigned pixel, unsigned width, unsigned height)
00330 {
00331  unsigned char* dst = (unsigned char*)void_dst;
00332  const unsigned char* src = (const unsigned char*)void_src;
00333  unsigned count;
00334  unsigned char* mid[6];
00335  
00336  assert(height >= 4);
00337  
00338  count = height;
00339  
00340  /* set the 6 buffer pointers */
00341  mid[0] = (unsigned char*)void_mid;
00342  mid[1] = mid[0] + mid_slice;
00343  mid[2] = mid[1] + mid_slice;
00344  mid[3] = mid[2] + mid_slice;
00345  mid[4] = mid[3] + mid_slice;
00346  mid[5] = mid[4] + mid_slice;
00347  
00348  stage_scale2x(SCMID(-2+6), SCMID(-1+6), SCSRC(0), SCSRC(0), SCSRC(1), pixel, width);
00349  stage_scale2x(SCMID(0), SCMID(1), SCSRC(0), SCSRC(1), SCSRC(2), pixel, width);
00350  stage_scale2x(SCMID(2), SCMID(3), SCSRC(1), SCSRC(2), SCSRC(3), pixel, width);
00351  stage_scale4x(SCDST(0), SCDST(1), SCDST(2), SCDST(3), SCMID(-2+6), SCMID(-2+6), SCMID(-1+6), SCMID(0), pixel, width);
00352  
00353  dst = SCDST(4);
00354  
00355  stage_scale4x(SCDST(0), SCDST(1), SCDST(2), SCDST(3), SCMID(-1+6), SCMID(0), SCMID(1), SCMID(2), pixel, width);
00356  
00357  dst = SCDST(4);
00358  
00359  count -= 4;
00360  while (count) {
00361   unsigned char* tmp;
00362   
00363   stage_scale2x(SCMID(4), SCMID(5), SCSRC(2), SCSRC(3), SCSRC(4), pixel, width);
00364   stage_scale4x(SCDST(0), SCDST(1), SCDST(2), SCDST(3), SCMID(1), SCMID(2), SCMID(3), SCMID(4), pixel, width);
00365   
00366   dst = SCDST(4);
00367   src = SCSRC(1);
00368   
00369   tmp = SCMID(0); /* shift by 2 position */
00370   SCMID(0) = SCMID(2);
00371   SCMID(2) = SCMID(4);
00372   SCMID(4) = tmp;
00373   tmp = SCMID(1);
00374   SCMID(1) = SCMID(3);
00375   SCMID(3) = SCMID(5);
00376   SCMID(5) = tmp;
00377   
00378   --count;
00379  }
00380  
00381  stage_scale2x(SCMID(4), SCMID(5), SCSRC(2), SCSRC(3), SCSRC(3), pixel, width);
00382  stage_scale4x(SCDST(0), SCDST(1), SCDST(2), SCDST(3), SCMID(1), SCMID(2), SCMID(3), SCMID(4), pixel, width);
00383  
00384  dst = SCDST(4);
00385  
00386  stage_scale4x(SCDST(0), SCDST(1), SCDST(2), SCDST(3), SCMID(3), SCMID(4), SCMID(5), SCMID(5), pixel, width);
00387  
00388 #if defined(__GNUC__) && defined(__i386__)
00389  scale2x_mmx_emms();
00390 #endif
00391 }
00392 
00393 /**
00394  * Apply the Scale4x effect on a bitmap.
00395  * The destination bitmap is filled with the scaled version of the source bitmap.
00396  * The source bitmap isn't modified.
00397  * The destination bitmap must be manually allocated before calling the function,
00398  * note that the resulting size is exactly 4x4 times the size of the source bitmap.
00399  * \note This function operates like ::scale4x_buf() but the intermediate buffer is
00400  * automatically allocated in the stack.
00401  * \param void_dst Pointer at the first pixel of the destination bitmap.
00402  * \param dst_slice Size in bytes of a destination bitmap row.
00403  * \param void_src Pointer at the first pixel of the source bitmap.
00404  * \param src_slice Size in bytes of a source bitmap row.
00405  * \param pixel Bytes per pixel of the source and destination bitmap.
00406  * \param width Horizontal size in pixels of the source bitmap.
00407  * \param height Vertical size in pixels of the source bitmap.
00408  */
00409 static void scale4x(void* void_dst, unsigned dst_slice, const void* void_src, unsigned src_slice, unsigned pixel, unsigned width, unsigned height)
00410 {
00411  unsigned mid_slice;
00412  void* mid;
00413  
00414  mid_slice = 2 * pixel * width; /* required space for 1 row buffer */
00415  
00416  mid_slice = (mid_slice + 0x7) & ~0x7; /* align to 8 bytes */
00417  
00418 #if HAVE_ALLOCA
00419  mid = alloca(6 * mid_slice); /* allocate space for 6 row buffers */
00420  
00421  assert(mid != 0); /* alloca should never fails */
00422 #else
00423  mid = malloc(6 * mid_slice); /* allocate space for 6 row buffers */
00424  
00425  if (!mid)
00426   return;
00427 #endif
00428  
00429  scale4x_buf(void_dst, dst_slice, mid, mid_slice, void_src, src_slice, pixel, width, height);
00430  
00431 #if !HAVE_ALLOCA
00432  free(mid);
00433 #endif
00434 }
00435 
00436 /**
00437  * Check if the scale implementation is applicable at the given arguments.
00438  * \param scale Scale factor. 2, 203 (fox 2x3), 204 (for 2x4), 3 or 4.
00439  * \param pixel Bytes per pixel of the source and destination bitmap.
00440  * \param width Horizontal size in pixels of the source bitmap.
00441  * \param height Vertical size in pixels of the source bitmap.
00442  * \return
00443  *   - -1 on precondition violated.
00444  *   - 0 on success.
00445  */
00446 int scale_precondition(unsigned scale, unsigned pixel, unsigned width, unsigned height)
00447 {
00448  if (pixel != 1 && pixel != 2 && pixel != 4)
00449   return -1;
00450  
00451  switch (scale) {
00452   case 202 :
00453   case 203 :
00454   case 204 :
00455   case 2 :
00456   case 303 :
00457   case 3 :
00458    if (height < 2)
00459     return -1;
00460    break;
00461   case 404 :
00462   case 4 :
00463    if (height < 4)
00464     return -1;
00465    break;
00466   default:
00467    return -1;
00468  }
00469  
00470  if (width < 2)
00471   return -1;
00472  
00473  return 0;
00474 }
00475 
00476 /**
00477  * Apply the Scale effect on a bitmap.
00478  * This function is simply a common interface for ::scale2x(), ::scale3x() and ::scale4x().
00479  * \param scale Scale factor. 2, 203 (fox 2x3), 204 (for 2x4), 3 or 4.
00480  * \param void_dst Pointer at the first pixel of the destination bitmap.
00481  * \param dst_slice Size in bytes of a destination bitmap row.
00482  * \param void_src Pointer at the first pixel of the source bitmap.
00483  * \param src_slice Size in bytes of a source bitmap row.
00484  * \param pixel Bytes per pixel of the source and destination bitmap.
00485  * \param width Horizontal size in pixels of the source bitmap.
00486  * \param height Vertical size in pixels of the source bitmap.
00487  */
00488 void scale(unsigned scale, void* void_dst, unsigned dst_slice, const void* void_src, unsigned src_slice, unsigned pixel, unsigned width, unsigned height)
00489 {
00490  switch (scale) {
00491   case 202 :
00492   case 2 :
00493    scale2x(void_dst, dst_slice, void_src, src_slice, pixel, width, height);
00494    break;
00495   case 203 :
00496    scale2x3(void_dst, dst_slice, void_src, src_slice, pixel, width, height);
00497    break;
00498   case 204 :
00499    scale2x4(void_dst, dst_slice, void_src, src_slice, pixel, width, height);
00500    break;
00501   case 303 :
00502   case 3 :
00503    scale3x(void_dst, dst_slice, void_src, src_slice, pixel, width, height);
00504    break;
00505   case 404 :
00506   case 4 :
00507    scale4x(void_dst, dst_slice, void_src, src_slice, pixel, width, height);
00508    break;
00509  }
00510 }
